application.name: footprintinit
application.brief: This program stores a polygon representing the Lat/Lon footprint of the image.
application.description: This program creates a latitude/longitude geometric polygon that determines the footprint of the image. This footprint is used in other programs such as autoseed.

parameter.name: INCREASEPRECISION
parameter.brief: Allow automatic adjustments to fix invalid polygons
parameter.description:
Enabeling this option will allow the automatic reduction of the SINC and LINC parameters whenever their current values result in an invalid polygon. In addition, a results group will be created with the keywords SINC/LINC which reveal what SINC/LINC values were actually used for the creation of the footprint.
NOTE: This parameter can result in a drastic increase in running time as well as a change to user input values.

parameter.name: INCTYPE
parameter.description: When true, use NUMVERTICES to set an approximate number of steps for the footprint. Otherwise use POLYLINC and POLYSINC to create the polygon based on the dimentions of the cube.

option.brief: Use POLYLINC and POLYSINC for polygon quality
option.description: Enable this option to use the number of samples and lines to skip around the perimeter of the image to compute the polygon footprint.
Enable this option to use a total number of vertices around the perimeter of the image to compute the polygon footprint.

parameter.name: LINC
parameter.brief: The accuracy of the footprint in the line direction (larger is less accurate)
parameter.description: This is approximately how many lines in the input image to skip for every point stored in the footprint.

parameter.name: SINC
parameter.brief: The accuracy of the footprint in the sample direction (larger is less accurate)
parameter.description: This is approximately how many samples in the input image to skip for every point stored in the footprint.

parameter.name: NUMVERTICES
parameter.description: Specifies the approximate number of vertices (+/- 3) to take around the image to compute the polygon footprint. (In limb images, the number of steps can be much more or less than 3 off.) Note that currently, an increment of 4 or less will not work for pushframe instruments such as THEMIS-VIS.

parameter.name: MAXEMISSION
parameter.description:
When this value is provided, footprintinit will only consider points with an emission angle less than or equal to the provided value.
There should never be an emission angle above 90. However, planet features can cause abnormalities.

parameter.name: MAXINCIDENCE
parameter.description:
When this value is provided, footprintinit will only consider points with an incidence angle less than or equal to the provided value.
There should never be an incidence angle above 90. However, planet features can cause abnormalities.

parameter.name: LIMBTEST
parameter.brief: Defines how limb images are to be handled
parameter.description: This parameter is used to specify how limb images are to be handled.

parameter.name: TESTXY
parameter.description: Tests the ability to project the footprint from lat/lon to x/y coordinates. If the test fails, an error will be thrown, and the lat/lon footprint will not be written to the input cube.

parameter.name: MAP
parameter.description: A file containing the desired XY mapping parameters. This file can be a simple label file, hand produced or created via the "maptemplate" program. It can also be an existing cube label which contains a Mapping group. In the later case the input cube will be transformed into the same map projection, resolution, etc.

helper.description: This helper button will cat out the mapping group of the given mapfile to the session log of the application
